title: مُرَاجَعَةٌ شَامِلَة
explanation: Review of key concepts from Books 1 and 2: demonstratives, relative pronouns, verb moods, participles, and object pronouns. Prepares for advanced verb morphology.

examples.english: The students who succeeded are hardworking
I saw him sitting in front of the house

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب فَعَّلَ (II)
explanation: Form II doubles the middle letter of the root. Meanings: causative (عَلِمَ→عَلَّمَ: know→teach), intensive (كَسَرَ→كَسَّرَ: break→shatter), or denominative. Pattern: فَعَّلَ/يُفَعِّلُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب فَاعَلَ (III)
explanation: Form III adds alif after the first letter. Meanings: attempting action with someone (mutual/reciprocal). Pattern: فَاعَلَ/يُفَاعِلُ. Often involves interaction between two parties.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب أَفْعَلَ (IV)
explanation: Form IV adds hamza prefix. Meanings: causative (خَرَجَ→أَخْرَجَ: exit→cause to exit), transitivizing, or entering a state. Pattern: أَفْعَلَ/يُفْعِلُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب تَفَعَّلَ (V)
explanation: Form V adds ت to Form II. Meanings: reflexive of Form II (عَلَّمَ→تَعَلَّمَ: teach→learn), gradual process, or pretending. Pattern: تَفَعَّلَ/يَتَفَعَّلُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب تَفَاعَلَ (VI)
explanation: Form VI adds ت to Form III. Meanings: reciprocal action between multiple parties, pretending (تَمَارَضَ: pretend to be sick). Pattern: تَفَاعَلَ/يَتَفَاعَلُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب اِنْفَعَلَ (VII)
explanation: Form VII adds ن prefix. Meanings: passive/reflexive of Form I, often physical or spontaneous. Cannot take direct object. Pattern: اِنْفَعَلَ/يَنْفَعِلُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب اِفْتَعَلَ (VIII)
explanation: Form VIII adds infixed ت after first root letter. Meanings: reflexive, middle voice, mutual action. Pattern: اِفْتَعَلَ/يَفْتَعِلُ. Note: assimilation rules apply (اِصْطَبَرَ).

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب اِفْعَلَّ (IX)
explanation: Form IX doubles the last letter. Exclusively for colors and physical defects. Pattern: اِفْعَلَّ/يَفْعَلُّ. Rarely used but distinctive.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب اِسْتَفْعَلَ (X)
explanation: Form X adds اِسْت prefix. Meanings: seeking/requesting (اِسْتَغْفَرَ: seek forgiveness), considering something to be (اِسْتَحْسَنَ: consider good). Pattern: اِسْتَفْعَلَ/يَسْتَفْعِلُ.

examples.english: He was able to do it

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمِثَال
explanation: Verbs with و or ي as first root letter. In Form I present tense, the و often drops (وَجَدَ/يَجِدُ). Imperative also loses the و (جِدْ!). Other forms are regular.

examples.english: I found the key / I find

title: الْفِعْلُ الأَجْوَف
explanation: Verbs with و or ي as second root letter. The weak letter appears as long vowel (قَالَ، زَارَ). In jussive and imperative, the vowel shortens or drops (لَمْ يَقُلْ، قُلْ).

title: الْفِعْلُ النَّاقِص
explanation: Verbs with و or ي as third root letter. Final letter changes based on conjugation: مَشَى/يَمْشِي، دَعَا/يَدْعُو. In jussive: لَمْ يَمْشِ، لَمْ يَدْعُ.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَهْمُوز
explanation: Verbs with hamza (ء) in the root. Hamza position affects spelling: أَخَذَ (initial), سَأَلَ (middle), قَرَأَ (final). Conjugation is regular but hamza may change shape.

title: الْفِعْلُ الْمُضَعَّف
explanation: Verbs where second and third root letters are the same (مَرَّ، رَدَّ). In conjugation, the doubled letters may separate (رَدَدْتُ) or remain together (يَرُدُّ).

examples.english: He passed / he passes / I passed
He replied / he replies / I replied
He thought / he thinks / I thought

title: الْفِعْلُ الرُّبَاعِي
explanation: Verbs with four-letter roots, often expressing repetitive or intensive actions. Pattern: فَعْلَلَ/يُفَعْلِلُ. Includes onomatopoeia and loanwords.

title: الْمَفْعُول الْمُطْلَق
explanation: A verbal noun from the same root as the verb, used for emphasis or describing manner. Always in accusative case. Answers 'how?' or intensifies the action.

examples.english: I hit him severely (lit: a severe hitting)

title: الْمَفْعُول لأَجْلِهِ
explanation: A verbal noun in accusative expressing the reason/purpose for the main action. Must share subject and time with main verb. Answers 'why?'.

examples.english: He stood out of respect for the guest
He was silent out of fear of punishment

title: التَّمْيِيز
explanation: An indefinite accusative noun that clarifies an ambiguous element. Two types: تمييز ذات (specifying measure/number) and تمييز نسبة (specifying relation/comparison).

examples.english: She became happy (lit: good in soul)

title: أُسْلُوب التَّعَجُّب
explanation: Expressing wonder/admiration using two patterns: مَا أَفْعَلَهُ (How X it is!) and أَفْعِلْ بِهِ (How X it is!). The first is more common. Formed from tri-literal, positive, gradable adjectives.

title: أَعْلَمَ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا
explanation: Certain verbs take three objects: the first is the person informed, the second and third form a mubtada-khabar relationship. Main verbs: أَعْلَمَ (to inform), أَرَى (to show), أَنْبَأَ (to notify), حَدَّثَ (to tell), أَخْبَرَ (to inform).

examples.english: I informed him (that) the matter (is) easy
I informed you (that) the news (is) true

title: لاَ النَّافِيَة لِلْجِنْس
explanation: لاَ النَّافِيَة لِلْجِنْس negates the entire genus/species. Its noun (اسم لا) is indefinite and takes fatha if singular without tanwin. Like إِنَّ, it has اسم (accusative) and خبر (nominative).

examples.english: There is no god except Allah
There is no compulsion in religion
There is no doubt in it

title: المَفْعُول المُطْلَق
explanation: A masdar from the same root as the verb, used for emphasis or describing manner. Types: تَوْكِيدِيّ (emphasis: ضَرَبْتُهُ ضَرْبًا), نَوْعِيّ (manner: ضَرْبًا شَدِيدًا), عَدَدِيّ (number: ضَرْبَتَيْنِ).

examples.english: I hit him a hard blow

title: المَفْعُول لأَجْلِهِ
explanation: A masdar in the accusative expressing the reason/purpose of the action. Must share the same subject and time as the main verb. Common examples: طَلَبًا (seeking), رَغْبَةً (desiring), خَوْفًا (fearing), إِجْلاَلاً (respecting).

examples.english: I stood out of respect for him
He fled out of fear of the enemy

title: المَفْعُول مَعَهُ
explanation: A noun in accusative after وَاو المَعِيَّة (waw of accompaniment) indicating something happening alongside the action. The waw cannot be replaced by مَعَ without changing the meaning.

examples.english: What is with you and laziness?

title: المَفْعُول فِيهِ (الظَّرْف)
explanation: Nouns indicating time (ظَرْف زَمَان) or place (ظَرْف مَكَان) in the accusative. Time: يَوْمًا, لَيْلاً, صَبَاحًا. Place: أَمَامَ, خَلْفَ, يَمِينًا, شِمَالاً, فَوْقَ, تَحْتَ.

examples.english: He sat in front of the house

title: الجُمْلَة الشَّرْطِيَّة
explanation: Conditionals have شَرْط (protasis) and جَوَاب (apodosis). Particles: إِنْ (uncertain), إِذَا (likely/temporal), لَوْ (past hypothetical), لَوْلاَ (if not for), مَنْ/مَا/أَيْنَ etc. (relative conditionals).

examples.english: If you study, you will succeed
If he had studied, he would have succeeded
Were it not for Allah, we would have perished

title: جَوَاب الشَّرْط
explanation: The جَوَاب الشَّرْط responds to the condition. With إِنْ: jussive or imperative. With لَوْ: past + لَ. The فَ is added when jawab is nominal sentence, imperative, or begins with certain particles (قَدْ, سَ, لَنْ, مَا).

examples.english: If he comes, then tell him
If he had come, I would have honored him
Whoever does good will find it

title: الأَفْعَال الخَمْسَة
explanation: Five present tense forms with nun: يَفْعَلاَنِ (they two, m.), تَفْعَلاَنِ (you two), يَفْعَلُونَ (they, m.), تَفْعَلُونَ (you, m. pl.), تَفْعَلِينَ (you, f. sing.). Marfu' with nun, mansub/majzum the nun drops.

examples.english: They two did not write (nun dropped)

title: المَجْزُوم
explanation: The jussive (مَجْزُوم) is used after: لَمْ (didn't), لَمَّا (not yet), لاَ النَّاهِيَة (prohibition), لِـ (command), and conditional particles. Sound verbs take sukun, five verbs drop nun, weak verbs drop final letter.

title: الفِعْل المُضَارِع المَبْنِيّ
explanation: The present tense becomes مَبْنِيّ (indeclinable) when attached to: نُون النِّسْوَة (they f.: يَفْعَلْنَ - built on sukun) or نُون التَّوْكِيد (emphasis: لَيَفْعَلَنَّ/لَيَفْعَلَنْ - built on fatha).

examples.english: By Allah, I will surely do it

title: النَّوَاسِخ
explanation: Nawasikh are particles/verbs that modify the mubtada-khabar structure. Three types: كَانَ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا (ism marfu', khabar mansub), إِنَّ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا (ism mansub, khabar marfu'), ظَنَّ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا (two accusative objects).

title: الإِعْرَاب التَّقْدِيرِيّ
explanation: Some nouns cannot show visible case endings. المَقْصُور (ending in alif): الفَتَى - endings estimated. المَنْقُوص (ending in ya): القَاضِي - damma/kasra estimated, ya shows in nasb. Indeclinable nouns: مُوسَى.

title: الْبَدَل
explanation: البَدَل is a noun that replaces or clarifies another noun and matches it in case. Types: بَدَل كُلّ مِنْ كُلّ (total), بَدَل بَعْض مِنْ كُلّ (partial), بَدَل اشْتِمَال (inclusion). The second noun takes the case of the first.

examples.english: I ate the loaf, a third of it (partial)

title: عَطْف النَّسَق
explanation: عَطْف النَّسَق connects nouns using conjunctions (حُرُوف الْعَطْف). The second noun (مَعْطُوف) follows the case of the first (مَعْطُوف عَلَيْهِ). Common particles: وَ، فَ، ثُمَّ، أَوْ، أَمْ، لاَ، بَلْ، لَكِنْ.

examples.english: I saw the student then the teacher
He is a doctor, not an engineer

title: التَّوْكِيد
explanation: التَّوْكِيد reinforces a noun. لَفْظِيّ (verbal) repeats the word. مَعْنَوِيّ (semantic) uses words like نَفْس/عَيْن (self), كُلّ/جَمِيع (all), كِلاَ/كِلْتَا (both). The emphasis matches the case of the emphasized noun.

title: الْعَطْف بِالْحُرُوف
explanation: Each conjunction has specific meaning: وَ (and, simultaneous), فَ (immediate sequence), ثُمَّ (delayed sequence), أَوْ (or, choice), أَمْ (or, in questions), بَلْ (rather), لاَ (not), لَكِنْ (but).

title: الْمُنَادَى
explanation: الْمُنَادَى is the noun being called using يَا or similar. Types affect case: مُفْرَد مَعْرِفَة (definite singular) is built on damma, مُضَاف (construct) is accusative, نَكِرَة غَيْر مَقْصُودَة is accusative with tanween.

title: الْمُسْتَثْنَى بِإِلَّا
explanation: الْمُسْتَثْنَى is the excepted noun. After إِلَّا in complete affirmative sentences, it's accusative. In negative/incomplete sentences, it can follow the case required by its position or be accusative.

examples.english: No one came except Muhammad (nominative allowed)

title: الاسْمُ الْمَوْصُول
explanation: الاسْم الْمَوْصُول connects a noun to a descriptive clause. الَّذِي (m. sing.), الَّتِي (f. sing.), اللَّذَانِ/اللَّذَيْنِ (m. dual), اللَّتَانِ/اللَّتَيْنِ (f. dual), الَّذِينَ (m. pl.), اللَّاتِي/اللَّوَاتِي (f. pl.).

title: صِلَة الْمَوْصُول
explanation: صِلَة الْمَوْصُول is the clause following the relative pronoun. It must contain a pronoun (ضَمِير عَائِد) referring back to the relative pronoun. The clause has no independent grammatical position.

examples.english: Who won the prize (intransitive, no pronoun needed)

title: الاسْتِفْهَام
explanation: Question words include: هَلْ/أَ (yes/no), مَا/مَاذَا (what), مَنْ (who), أَيْنَ (where), مَتَى (when), كَيْفَ (how), لِمَاذَا/لِمَ (why), كَمْ (how many), أَيّ (which). Position and structure depend on the particle.

title: الْفِعْل الْمَبْنِيّ لِلْمَجْهُول
explanation: The passive removes the doer. Past passive: فُعِلَ (كُتِبَ). Present passive: يُفْعَلُ (يُكْتَبُ). The object becomes نَائِب الْفَاعِل (deputy subject) and takes nominative case.

examples.english: The student was given a prize

title: أَفْعَالُ الْمُقَارَبَة - كَادَ
explanation: كَادَ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا are verbs indicating an action is about to happen. كَادَ (almost), أَوْشَكَ (be on the verge of). They take an ism (nominative) and a khabar that is a present tense verb, usually with أَنْ.

examples.english: The sun was about to set
The year is about to end

title: أَفْعَالُ الْمُقَارَبَة - أَوْشَكَ وَكَرَبَ
titleEn: Verbs of Imminence - Awshaka and Karaba
explanation: أَوْشَكَ indicates being on the verge of something, usually used with أَنْ + present verb. كَرَبَ is similar but less common. Both belong to the كَادَ family and function similarly in sentence structure.

examples.english: The rain was about to fall
The train was about to arrive

title: أَفْعَالُ الرَّجَاء - عَسَى
explanation: عَسَى expresses hope or expectation. It takes an ism (nominative) and khabar as أَنْ + present verb. It can be a complete verb (عَسَى أَنْ يَأْتِيَ) or incomplete with ism and khabar (عَسَى زَيْدٌ أَنْ يَنْجَحَ).

examples.english: May Allah have mercy on us

title: أَفْعَالُ الرَّجَاء - حَرَى وَاخْلَوْلَقَ
titleEn: Verbs of Hope - Hara and Ikhlawlaqa
explanation: حَرَى and اخْلَوْلَقَ are less common verbs of hope, similar to عَسَى. They express expectation that something will happen. The khabar must be أَنْ + present tense verb.

examples.english: The student is expected to succeed
The clouds are likely to rain
The matter is expected to improve

title: أَفْعَالُ الشُّرُوع - شَرَعَ وَبَدَأَ
titleEn: Verbs of Beginning - Shara'a and Bada'a
explanation: أَفْعَالُ الشُّرُوع indicate starting an action. Common verbs: شَرَعَ، بَدَأَ، أَخَذَ، جَعَلَ، طَفِقَ، أَنْشَأَ. They take ism (nominative) and khabar as present verb WITHOUT أَنْ.

title: أَفْعَالُ الشُّرُوع - جَعَلَ وَطَفِقَ
titleEn: Verbs of Beginning - Ja'ala and Tafiqa
explanation: جَعَلَ and طَفِقَ are verbs of beginning. جَعَلَ when meaning 'to begin' (not 'to make') takes a present verb without أَنْ. طَفِقَ is a classical verb of beginning found in Quranic Arabic.

title: الْجُمْلَةُ الْمُرَكَّبَة - أَنْوَاعُهَا
explanation: Complex sentences contain a main clause and subordinate clause(s). Types include: جملة شرطية (conditional), جملة موصولة (relative), جملة حالية (circumstantial), جملة مقولية (reported speech).

examples.english: I saw the one who won (relative)

title: الْجُمْلَةُ الْمُرَكَّبَة - الرَّبْط
explanation: Subordinate clauses are linked using various connectors: أَنَّ/أَنْ (that), الَّذِي (who/which), إِذَا/إِنْ (if), لَمَّا/حِينَ (when), لِأَنَّ/لِكَيْ (because/so that), رَغْمَ أَنَّ (although).

examples.english: I knew that he was traveling
He studied so that he would succeed
Although he was sick, he went

title: مُرَاجَعَة الْأَفْعَال النَّاقِصَة
explanation: Comprehensive review of كَانَ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا، كَادَ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا، أَفْعَال الرَّجَاء، أَفْعَال الشُّرُوع. All modify the mubtada-khabar structure. Understanding their usage patterns is essential for advanced Arabic.

examples.arabic: كَانَ مُجْتَهِدًا / كَادَ يَنْجَحُ / عَسَى أَنْ يَفُوزَ / شَرَعَ يَعْمَلُ
examples.english: He was diligent / He almost succeeded / He may win / He began working
He became a scholar / He was about to fall
He remained silent / He began speaking

title: مُرَاجَعَة الْجُمَل الْمُرَكَّبَة
explanation: Review of all complex sentence types: conditional (شرطية), relative (موصولة), circumstantial (حالية), purpose (غائية), causal (سببية). Mastering these structures enables sophisticated Arabic expression.

examples.english: The book that I read is useful (relative)

title: إِعْمَال الْمَصْدَر - تَعْرِيف
explanation: The masdar (verbal noun) can govern like its verb, taking a direct object in accusative. Example: عَجِبْتُ مِنْ ضَرْبِكَ زَيْدًا (I was amazed at your hitting Zaid).

examples.english: I was amazed at your hitting Zaid
Your reading the Quran pleased me
His memorizing the lesson impressed me

title: إِعْمَال الْمَصْدَر - التَّرْكِيب
explanation: When masdar has subject and object, subject typically comes in إضافة, object takes accusative. Alternative: Subject with لِـ and object in إضافة.

examples.english: Your honoring the guest pleased me
I regretted my abandoning the prayer

title: إِعْمَال اسْم الْفَاعِل - الشُّرُوط
explanation: اسم الفاعل can take objects but requires conditions: present/future time, and preceded by negation (ما), question (أ), or describing a noun.

examples.english: Your brother is not hitting Zaid
This is a man hitting his son

title: اسْم الْفَاعِل مَعَ أَل
explanation: When اسم الفاعل has ال, it can take an object freely without previous conditions. It acts more like a noun but retains verbal force: الضَّارِبُ زَيْدًا (the one hitting Zaid).

examples.english: I saw the one reading the book
He is the one memorizing the Quran

title: أَسْمَاء الأَفْعَال - تَعْرِيف
explanation: أسماء الأفعال are nouns with verb meanings but don't conjugate. Three types: past-meaning (هَيْهَاتَ), present-meaning (أُفٍّ), imperative-meaning (صَهْ، آمِينَ، هَلُمَّ).

examples.english: Amen, O Lord of the Worlds

title: أَسْمَاء الأَفْعَال - الأَقْسَام
explanation: Past: هَيْهَاتَ (بَعُدَ), شَتَّانَ (اِفْتَرَقَ). Present: أُفٍّ (أَتَضَجَّرُ). Imperative: صَهْ (اُسْكُتْ), آمِينَ (اِسْتَجِبْ), هَلُمَّ (تَعَالَ).

title: مَا الْعَامِلَة عَمَلَ لَيْسَ
explanation: مَا can work like لَيْسَ, negating nominal sentences with subject nominative and predicate accusative. Called مَا الحِجَازِيَّة. Conditions: predicate cannot precede subject, no إِلَّا.

title: لَا وَإِنْ الْعَامِلَتَان عَمَلَ لَيْسَ
titleEn: La and In Working Like Laysa
explanation: لَا النَّافِيَة لِلْجِنْس can work like لَيْسَ. إِنْ meaning 'not' also works like لَيْسَ: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ (He is nothing but a warner). Common in Quranic Arabic.

examples.english: No man is better than him
There is no god but Allah
He is nothing but a warner

title: نُونَا التَّوْكِيد - تَعْرِيف
explanation: Two emphasis nuns: heavy (نَّ) and light (نْ). They attach to present tense verbs for emphasis, common after oaths and with لَام التوكيد. Heavy is more emphatic.

examples.english: By Allah, I will surely go
You will surely be asked about your deeds

title: نُونَا التَّوْكِيد - الاسْتِعْمَال
explanation: Contexts: after oath + لام (وَاللهِ لَأَفْعَلَنَّ), with لَا in commands (لَا تَفْعَلَنَّ). Verb becomes مبني على الفتح before نّ. Common in Quran: لَنَسْفَعًا (We will surely drag).

examples.english: Do not think Allah is unaware
I will surely punish him severely

title: المَمْنُوع مِنَ الصَّرْف - لِعِلَّة وَاحِدَة
explanation: Some patterns are diptote due to one strong reason: صيغة منتهى الجموع (مَسَاجِد، مَصَابِيح) and ألف التأنيث (صَحْرَاء، كُبْرَى). These don't take tanween or kasra.

title: المَمْنُوع مِنَ الصَّرْف - لِعِلَّتَيْن
explanation: Many diptotes require two reasons. Proper nouns + foreign/feminine/زيادة/verb pattern: إِبْرَاهِيم، فَاطِمَة، عُثْمَان، أَحْمَد. Adjectives + أَفْعَل/فَعْلَان/عُدُول: أَحْمَر، عَطْشَان، أُخَر.

examples.english: I passed by Ibrahim (فتحة not كسرة)

title: لَوْ الشَّرْطِيَّة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: لو is for counterfactual conditions (what didn't happen). Called حرف امتناع لامتناع: result absent because condition was absent. Structure: لَوْ + past verb + لَ + past verb.

examples.english: If he had come, I would have honored him
If you had studied, you would have passed
If I had known, I would have told you

title: لَوْ vs إِنْ
explanation: إن is for possible future conditions. لو is for impossible/counterfactual past. إن uses jussive: إِنْ تَفْعَلْ أَفْعَلْ. لو uses past tense: لَوْ فَعَلْتَ لَفَعَلْتُ.

examples.english: If you strive, you will pass (possible)
If you had strived, you would have passed (didn't happen)
If only you would visit us! (wish)

title: لَوْلَا - التَّرْكِيب
explanation: لولا means 'were it not for'. Followed by nominative noun (مبتدأ), خبر is obligatorily deleted (تقديره: موجود). Response uses past with لَ: لَوْلَا الْمَطَرُ لَذَهَبْتُ.

examples.english: Were it not for the rain, I would have gone
Were it not for Allah, we would have perished
Were it not for you, I wouldn't have known

title: لَوْلَا لِلتَّحْضِيض
explanation: لولا can urge or reproach. With present verb: 'why don't you?' With past verb: 'you should have'. Not conditional here: لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ (Why don't you seek forgiveness?).

examples.english: Why don't you seek Allah's forgiveness?
You should have come to me yesterday

title: إِعْرَاب الجُمَل - المَحَلّ
explanation: Sentences can occupy grammatical positions (محل من الإعراب). Seven types have محل: خبرية، حالية، مفعولية، مضاف إليه، جواب شرط مقترن بالفاء، تابعة، محكية.

examples.english: The student studies (يدرس = خبر في محل رفع)
He came laughing (وهو يضحك = حال في محل نصب)
I came the day you traveled (سافرت = مضاف إليه في محل جر)

title: الجُمْلَة الحَالِيَّة وَالصِّفَة
explanation: الجملة الحالية describes state (في محل نصب): جَاءَ يَبْتَسِمُ. الجملة الصفة describes indefinite nouns (takes its case): رَأَيْتُ رَجُلًا يَكْتُبُ (في محل نصب صفة).

examples.english: A man carrying a book came (صفة)

title: الإِعْلَال - الأَنْوَاع
explanation: Three types: القلب (conversion: قَوَلَ → قَالَ), الحذف (deletion: يَقْوُلُ → يَقُولُ), الإسكان (silencing). Weak letters و، ي، ا change for ease of pronunciation.

title: الإِبْدَال
explanation: الإبدال replaces one letter with another. Common: ت of افتعل becomes ط after ص/ض/ط/ظ, becomes د after د/ذ/ز. Example: اصْتَبَرَ → اصْطَبَرَ، ازْتَهَرَ → ازْدَهَرَ.

title: المِيزَان الصَّرْفِيّ - الأَسَاس
explanation: The scale uses فعل as template: ف = 1st root letter, ع = 2nd, ل = 3rd. Extra letters appear in same position. كَتَبَ = فَعَلَ، كَاتِب = فَاعِل، مَكْتُوب = مَفْعُول.

title: المِيزَان الصَّرْفِيّ - الأَوْزَان الشَّائِعَة
explanation: Common patterns: أَفْعَلَ (Form IV), تَفَعَّلَ (Form V), اِسْتَفْعَلَ (Form X). Noun patterns: مُفَعِّل (teacher from Form II), مِفْعَال (instrument). حروف الزيادة: سألتمونيها.

title: الاسْتِغَاثَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الاستغاثة is a vocative to seek help: يَا لَزَيْدٍ! The المستغاث به takes لام مفتوحة (open lam), and the المستغاث له takes لام مكسورة.

title: الاسْتِغَاثَة - لَام المُسْتَغَاث
explanation: لام المستغاث به is مفتوحة (يَا لَزَيْدٍ). لام المستغاث له is مكسورة (لِعَمْرٍو). When ال is present, the لام merges: يَا لَلْمُسْلِمِينَ.

examples.english: O my people! (save us) from oppression!

title: النَّدْبَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الندبة is vocative of grief using وَا or يَا with ألف added: وَامُحَمَّدَاهْ. Often ends with هاء السكت for pausing.

title: النَّدْبَة - أَلِف النَّدْبَة وَهَاء السَّكْت
explanation: ألف الندبة is added to the lamented: وَازَيْدَا. هاء السكت is added when pausing: وَازَيْدَاهْ. Both express grief.

title: التَّرْخِيم - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الترخيم is dropping letters from the end of a vocative name: يَا فَاطِمُ (from فَاطِمَة). Shows affection or ease of speech.

title: التَّرْخِيم - لُغَتَان
explanation: Two ways: لغة من ينتظر keeps original vowel (يَا حَارِ), لغة من لا ينتظر treats remaining as new name (يَا حَارُ with damma).

title: نِعْمَ وَبِئْسَ - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: نِعْمَ (praise) and بِئْسَ (blame) are جامدة (invariable) verbs. They require فاعل (general) and مخصوص (specific praised/blamed thing).

examples.english: What an excellent man Zayd is!
What a terrible trait lying is!

title: نِعْمَ وَبِئْسَ - الْفَاعِل وَالْمَخْصُوص
titleEn: Praise and Blame - Subject and Specific
explanation: الفاعل must be معرفة (with ال or مضاف). المخصوص is the specific thing praised/blamed, parsed as مبتدأ مؤخر or خبر لمبتدأ محذوف.

title: حَبَّذَا - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: حَبَّذَا = حَبَّ (verb) + ذَا (demonstrative). Expresses strong approval: حَبَّذَا الْعِلْمُ! (How excellent is knowledge!).

examples.english: How excellent Zayd is as a man!

title: لَا حَبَّذَا - النَّفْي
explanation: لَا حَبَّذَا expresses disapproval: لَا حَبَّذَا الْكَذِبُ! (How terrible is lying!). Opposite of حَبَّذَا.

title: الإِغْرَاء - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الإغراء urges good through accusative nouns, often repeated: الصِّدْقَ الصِّدْقَ! The verb is understood (الْزَمْ).

title: التَّحْذِير - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: التحذير warns against evil using إِيَّاكَ وَ: إِيَّاكَ وَالْكَذِبَ! Or repeating: النَّارَ النَّارَ! The verb (احْذَرْ) is understood.

title: الاخْتِصَاص - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الاختصاص specifies who a pronoun refers to: نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ. المختص is منصوب by understood أَخُصُّ.

title: الاخْتِصَاص - أَنْوَاع الْمُخْتَصّ
explanation: المختص can be: معرف بأل (نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ), مضاف (نَحْنُ مَعْشَرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ), or أَيُّهَا/أَيَّتُهَا (نَحْنُ أَيُّهَا الطُّلَّابُ).

examples.english: We prophets are not inherited from (hadith)
We, the People of the House...

title: أَمَّا الشَّرْطِيَّة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: أَمَّا is a conditional particle meaning 'as for.' It requires فَ in the response: أَمَّا زَيْدٌ فَذَهَبَ. Derived from مَهْمَا يَكُنْ.

examples.english: As for knowledge, it is beneficial

examples.arabic: أَمَّا بَعْدُ فَإِنَّ خَيْرَ الْكَلَامِ كَلَامُ اللهِ
examples.english: To proceed: the best speech is Allah's

title: أَمَّا الشَّرْطِيَّة - الْفَاء الْوَاجِبَة
explanation: فَاء الجزاء after أَمَّا is واجبة (obligatory). Common in Quran: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ (As for the orphan, do not oppress).

examples.english: As for the orphan, do not oppress (93:9)
As for the petitioner, do not repel (93:10)
As for the ship, it belonged to poor people (18:79)

title: الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: المصدر المؤول is أَنْ + verb interpreted as masdar: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ = أُرِيدُ الذَّهَابَ. Functions as noun in sentence.

examples.english: I want to go = I want going
It pleases me that you succeeded = Your success pleases me
I knew that he is coming

title: الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل - الْمَوَاقِع الإِعْرَابِيَّة
explanation: المصدر المؤول can be: مبتدأ (أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ), فاعل (يَسُرُّنِي أَنْ تَنْجَحَ), مفعول به (أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَقْرَأَ), مجرور (عَجِبْتُ مِنْ أَنَّكَ فَعَلْتَ).

examples.english: And fasting is better for you (2:184)
Has the time not come for their hearts to humble? (57:16)

title: الْمَوْصُول الْحَرْفِيّ - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الموصول الحرفي are particles that with their clause form مصدر مؤول: أَنْ، أَنَّ، كَيْ، لَوْ، مَا. Unlike الموصول الاسمي (الذي), they have no عائد.

examples.english: I came to learn = for learning

title: الْمَوْصُول الْحَرْفِيّ - أَنْواعُهُ
explanation: Five types: أَنْ الناصبة (تنصب المضارع), أَنَّ المشددة (تنصب الاسم), كَيْ (للتعليل), لَوْ المصدرية (للتمني), مَا المصدرية (للوقت أو المصدر).

examples.english: They wish that you would compromise (68:9)
I came in order to greet you

title: الإِدْغَام - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الإدغام is merging two letters into one with shaddah: مَدَّ from مَدَدَ. First letter becomes vowelless and merges into the second.

title: الإِدْغَام - الْكَبِير وَالصَّغِير
explanation: الإدغام الصغير: first letter already vowelless (مِنْ نَارٍ). الإدغام الكبير: first letter has vowel, made vowelless then merged (تَتَوَفَّاهُمْ → تَوَفَّاهُمْ in some readings).

title: الإِمَالَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الإمالة is tilting fatha toward kasra, and alif toward ya: هُدَى pronounced closer to 'hudey'. Found in readings of Hamzah, Kisai, and partially Warsh.

title: الإِمَالَة - الْكُبْرَى وَالصُّغْرَى
explanation: الإمالة الكبرى: fatha becomes like kasra, alif like ya (Hamzah/Kisai). الإمالة الصغرى/التقليل: sound between fatha and kasra (Warsh from Nafi').

title: إِذَنْ - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: إِذَنْ is a حرف جواب وجزاء (response particle). It gives nasb to mudari' under conditions: صدارة (first position), استقبال (future meaning), اتصال (no separation).

examples.english: I will visit you - Then I will honor you

examples.arabic: قَالَ: سَأَذْهَبُ. قُلْتُ: إِذَنْ أَذْهَبَ مَعَكَ
examples.english: He said: I will go. I said: Then I will go with you

title: إِذَنْ - شُرُوط النَّصْب
explanation: إِذَنْ causes nasb when: (1) at start of response, (2) verb indicates future, (3) no separation except by قَسَم or لَا. If conditions unmet, verb is marfu'.

examples.english: Then by Allah I will honor you (separated by oath)
I then will honor you (not initial - rafa')
Then I shall not oppose you (separated by la)

title: رُبَّ - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: رُبَّ is حرف جر شبيه بالزائد (preposition-like extra). Gives jarr in لفظ but raf' in محل: رُبَّ رَجُلٍ كَرِيمٍ لَقِيتُهُ (رجل is fa'il in meaning).

examples.english: Many a generous man I have met

examples.arabic: رُبَّ أَخٍ لَكَ لَمْ تَلِدْهُ أُمُّكَ
examples.english: Many a brother you have whom your mother did not bear
Many a word said to its speaker: leave me

title: رُبَّ - التَّقْلِيل وَالتَّكْثِير
explanation: رُبَّ originally indicates قِلَّة (paucity) but often used for تَكْثِير (abundance) as rhetorical understatement. Context determines meaning.

examples.english: Perhaps a harmful thing is beneficial (paucity)
Many a night as if it were morning (abundance)
Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish (15:2)

title: جَمْع التَّكْسِير - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: جمع التكسير changes the singular's pattern: كِتَاب → كُتُب, رَجُل → رِجَال. Unlike sound plurals, the word structure changes significantly.

title: جَمْع التَّكْسِير - أَوْزَان شَائِعَة
explanation: Common patterns: أَفْعَال (أَقْلَام), فُعُول (قُلُوب), فِعَال (جِبَال), أَفْعِلَة (أَطْعِمَة), فَعَائِل (رَسَائِل), فَوَاعِل (جَوَاهِر), مَفَاعِل (مَسَاجِد).

title: هَمْزَة الْوَصْل - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: همزة الوصل is pronounced only at the start of speech, dropped in continuous reading: اَلْكِتَابُ becomes 'l-kitaabu' after vowel. Written as ا without hamza mark.

title: هَمْزَة الْقَطْع - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: همزة القطع is always pronounced whether starting or continuing: أَكَلَ, إِبْرَاهِيم. Written with hamza mark (أ/إ/ؤ/ئ). Default for words not having وصل.

title: الْجُمَل الَّتِي لَا مَحَلَّ لَهَا - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: Six types of sentences have no grammatical position: الجملة الابتدائية، الاستئنافية، صلة الموصول، جواب القسم، التفسيرية، الاعتراضية.

title: الْجُمَل الَّتِي لَا مَحَلَّ لَهَا - الأَنْوَاع
explanation: الابتدائية: opens speech. الاستئنافية: new topic. صلة الموصول: after relative. جواب القسم: oath response. التفسيرية: explains. الاعتراضية: parenthetical.

examples.english: By Allah, I will do it (oath response)
Al-Shafi'i - may Allah have mercy on him - said (parenthetical)

title: الْحُرُوف الزَّائِدَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الحروف الزائدة are added for emphasis without changing meaning. Word after is مجرور لفظًا but keeps original position محلًّا.

examples.english: Allah suffices as witness (ب is extra)
No warner came to us (من is extra)

title: الْحُرُوف الزَّائِدَة - الأَنْوَاع
explanation: Types: الباء الزائدة (after كفى، ليس), من الزائدة (after negation), اللام الزائدة (لام المزحلقة), ما الزائدة (for emphasis).

title: عَدَا وَخَلَا وَحَاشَا - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا can be verbs (مفعول به منصوب) or prepositions (مجرور). Both analyses are valid.

examples.english: They came except Zayd (both cases valid)

title: مَا عَدَا وَمَا خَلَا
explanation: When preceded by ما المصدرية, عَدَا/خَلَا must be verbs. The noun after is obligatorily منصوب.

title: الإِلْغَاء - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الإلغاء cancels governance of heart verbs when they come after objects. Objects become مبتدأ + خبر (both مرفوع).

examples.english: Zayd is standing, I thought (مبتدأ + خبر)
The matter is easy, I knew

title: التَّعْلِيق - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: التعليق suspends governance due to intervening particles with صدارة (لَ، ما، لا، أدوات الاستفهام). Sentence is في محل نصب.

examples.english: I knew that Zayd is standing (لَ blocks)
I thought Zayd was not standing

title: لَا سِيَّمَا - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: لَا سِيَّمَا means 'especially.' لَا is نافية للجنس, سِيَّ is its اسم. The noun after can be رفع، جر، or نصب.

title: لَا سِيَّمَا - إِعْرَاب مَا بَعْدَهَا
explanation: Three valid cases for noun after لا سيّما: رفع (خبر لمبتدأ محذوف), جر (مضاف إليه), نصب (تمييز or مفعول).

title: مَا الْكَافَّة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: ما الكافة prevents particles from governing. The particle becomes مكفوف (neutralized): إِنَّمَا، رُبَّمَا، كَأَنَّمَا.

examples.english: The believers are only brothers (no governance)
Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish

title: الْحَصْر بِإِنَّمَا
explanation: إِنَّمَا indicates حصر (restriction, meaning 'only'). It can precede nominal sentences or verbs, unlike إِنَّ alone.

title: كَأَيِّنْ - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: كَأَيِّنْ means 'how many' (like كم الخبرية). It is مبنية and takes تمييز with من: كَأَيِّنْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ.

title: كَذَا - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: كذا means 'such and such number.' It is مبنية and takes تمييز in نصب: كَذَا كِتَابًا.

title: نِدَاء مَا فِيهِ أَل
explanation: يَا cannot directly precede أل. Use أَيُّهَا (masc.) or أَيَّتُهَا (fem.) as intermediary: يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّجُلُ.

title: نِدَاء الْمُضَاف إِلَى يَاء الْمُتَكَلِّم
explanation: Options: يَا رَبِّ (ياء deleted), يَا رَبِّي (ياء retained), يَا أَبَتِ (with feminine ت for tenderness).

examples.english: O my father, why do you worship (Quran 19:42)

title: أَسْمَاء الْأَصْوَات - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: أسماء الأصوات represent sounds - animal calls, human expressions. They are مبنية (indeclinable).

title: أَسْمَاء الْأَصْوَات فِي الْقُرْآن
explanation: Quranic examples: أُفٍّ (disgust - 17:23), هَيْهَاتَ (far be it - 23:36). These express emotions without being full words.

examples.english: Far, far is what you are promised (Quran 23:36)

title: الْحِكَايَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الحكاية quotes speech exactly, preserving original i'rab. The quoted element is محكي (quoted).

examples.english: 'Daraba' is a past verb (quoting word itself)

title: الْحِكَايَة بِالْحَرْف
explanation: الحكاية بالحرف quotes letter-by-letter. Common in grammar explanations where words refer to themselves.

examples.english: The word 'Allah' is the word of majesty

title: التَّقْدِيم وَالتَّأْخِير - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: التقديم (fronting) moves elements earlier, التأخير (delaying) moves them later. Can be واجب، جائز، or ممتنع.

examples.english: In the house is a man (obligatory fronting)

title: التَّقْدِيم الْوَاجِب وَالْمُمْتَنِع
explanation: Obligatory: question words, predicate when subject is indefinite. Prohibited: separating مضاف/مضاف إليه, جار/مجرور.

title: أَقْسَام الْعَلَم - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: Types: المنقول (transferred from other word), المرتجل (originally coined), بالغلبة (by predominance), اللقب/الكنية.

title: اللَّقَب وَالْكُنْيَة
explanation: اللقب: nickname (الصِّدِّيق، الْفَارُوق). الكنية: with أَبُو/أُمّ (أَبُو بَكْر). Both are types of proper nouns.

title: ظُرُوف الْمَكَان - الْجِهَات السِّتّ
explanation: الجهات الست: فَوْقَ، تَحْتَ، أَمَامَ، خَلْفَ، يَمِين، شِمَال. These are مبهمة (vague), usually مضاف.

examples.english: The book is under the table

title: ظُرُوف مُتَصَرِّفَة وَغَيْر مُتَصَرِّفَة
explanation: متصرف: can be فاعل، مفعول، ظرف (يَوْم). غير متصرف: only ظرف or مجرور (عِنْدَ، لَدَى، بَيْنَ).

examples.english: A blessed day came (يَوْم as subject)
He sat near me (عِنْدَ only as adverb)

title: أَدَوَات الشَّرْط الْمُتَقَدِّمَة - لَمَّا وَكُلَّمَا
explanation: لَمَّا الحينية: temporal 'when' (realized past). كُلَّمَا: 'whenever' (repetition). Both followed by past verbs.

examples.english: When he came, I honored him

title: أَدَوَات الشَّرْط الْمَكَانِيَّة وَمَهْمَا
explanation: أَيْنَمَا، حَيْثُمَا، أَنَّى: wherever (place). مَهْمَا: whatever (comprehensive). All cause جَزْم.

examples.english: Wherever you are, death reaches you (Quran 4:78)
Whatever you do, I will do

title: تَعَدُّد الْخَبَر
explanation: One مبتدأ can have multiple أخبار, each مرفوع: زَيْدٌ عَالِمٌ كَرِيمٌ شُجَاعٌ.

title: أَحْكَام الْحَذْف
explanation: المبتدأ/الخبر can be deleted جوازًا (context clear) or وجوبًا (specific structures like after لولا). الفاعل uses passive instead.

examples.english: If not for Zayd, I'd perish (obligatory)

title: التَّحْذِير
explanation: التحذير warns against something harmful using إِيَّاكَ + noun or repeated nouns. The warned noun is منصوب as object of deleted verb احْذَرْ.

title: الإِغْرَاء
explanation: الإغراء urges toward something good using repeated nouns. The urged noun is منصوب as object of deleted verb الْزَمْ (adhere to).

title: الاخْتِصَاص
explanation: الاختصاص specifies a first-person pronoun (نَحْنُ/أَنَا) with an accusative noun. Deleted verb is أَخُصُّ (I specify).

examples.english: We prophets are not inherited from

title: الْمَخْصُوص فِي الاخْتِصَاص
explanation: المخصوص can be with أَلْ (الْعَرَبَ), with إضافة (مَعَاشِرَ الأَنْبِيَاء), or with أَيُّهَا (أَيُّهَا الطُّلَّاب). Must follow first-person pronoun.

title: ضَمِير الْفَصْل
explanation: ضمير الفصل is inserted between مُبْتَدَأ and خَبَر (both definite) for emphasis and to distinguish predicate from adjective. Has no i'rab position.

examples.english: Indeed You are the Knowing, Wise

title: وَظَائِف ضَمِير الْفَصْل
explanation: Three functions: التَّوْكِيد (emphasis), الْفَصْل (separating خَبَر from صِفَة), الْحَصْر (restriction). Basran view: لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ.

examples.arabic: زَيْدٌ الْعَالِمُ (صفة) vs زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْعَالِمُ (خبر)
examples.english: Zayd the scholar (adj) vs Zayd is the scholar (pred)
You were the Observer over them

title: أَمَّا الشَّرْطِيَّة
explanation: أَمَّا is a conditional particle meaning 'as for.' It REQUIRES فَاء (obligatory) in its response. Used for topic-comment structure.

examples.english: As for Zayd, he is generous
As for the orphan, do not oppress

title: الْفَرْق بَيْن أَمَّا وَإِمَّا
explanation: أَمَّا (فَتْحَة) is for تَفْصِيل (detailing) with فَاء. إِمَّا (كَسْرَة) is for تَخْيِير (choice) or شَكّ (doubt) with أَوْ or repeated إِمَّا.

title: الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل
explanation: المصدر المؤول is أَنْ + فِعْل or أَنَّ + جُمْلَة interpreted as a noun. It fills noun positions (مبتدأ، فاعل، مفعول، etc.).

examples.english: I want to learn = I want learning

title: مَوَاقِع الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل
explanation: Can be: مُبْتَدَأ (أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ), فَاعِل (يَسُرُّنِي أَنْ تَنْجَحَ), مَفْعُول (أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ), مَجْرُور (قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ).

examples.english: And that you fast is better for you (مبتدأ)
I came before you left (مضاف إليه)

title: الْجُمَل الَّتِي لَهَا مَحَلّ
explanation: Seven types: الْخَبَرِيَّة، الْحَالِيَّة، النَّعْتِيَّة، الْمَفْعُولِيَّة، الْمُضَاف إِلَيْهَا، جَوَاب الشَّرْط، الْمَعْطُوفَة. Each fills a noun position.

examples.arabic: زَيْدٌ يَدْرُسُ: الجملة في محل رفع خبر
جَاءَ زَيْدٌ يَضْحَكُ: الجملة في محل نصب حال
examples.english: Zayd came laughing: sentence as haal

title: الْجُمْلَة الْحَالِيَّة وَالنَّعْتِيَّة
explanation: الحالية describes state (في محل نصب), needs رَابِط. النعتية describes نَكِرَة (follows its case). Both are sentences with position.

examples.arabic: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ يَحْمِلُ كِتَابًا: الجملة في محل رفع نعت
examples.english: A man carrying a book came (adjectival)

title: نُون الْوِقَايَة
explanation: نون الوقاية is added before ياء المتكلم with verbs to protect them from kasra. Obligatory with verbs, permissible with إِنَّ group.

title: إِعْرَاب نُون الْوِقَايَة
explanation: نون الوقاية is حَرْف لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ (no grammatical position). The ياء after it is the actual pronoun with position (usually مفعول به).

examples.arabic: عَلَّمَنِي: النون حرف، الياء مفعول به
examples.english: He taught me: nun is particle, ya is object

title: أَمْ الْمُتَّصِلَة
explanation: أَمْ المتصلة follows همزة الاستفهام/التسوية and offers choice between options. It's حَرْف عَطْف. Answer specifies which option.

examples.english: Did Zayd come or Amr? (specify one)
Equal whether you warn them or not

title: أَمْ الْمُنْقَطِعَة
explanation: أَمْ المنقطعة introduces a new clause meaning 'or rather' (= بَلْ أَ). It's حَرْف ابْتِدَاء, not عَطْف. What follows is independent.

examples.english: Or did you think you'd enter Paradise?
Or do they have gods protecting them?

title: الضَّمِير الْمُسْتَتِر
explanation: الضمير المستتر is an understood pronoun serving as فَاعِل but not written. Every verb needs a subject - if none visible, it's estimated.

examples.arabic: كَتَبَ: الفاعل ضمير مستتر تقديره هُوَ
أَكْتُبُ: الفاعل ضمير مستتر تقديره أَنَا

title: وَاجِب وَجَائِز الاسْتِتَار
explanation: وَاجِب: أَنَا، نَحْنُ، أَنْتَ forms (can't be replaced). جَائِز: هُوَ، هِيَ forms (can have visible subject: يَذْهَبُ زَيْدٌ).

title: الاسْم الْمَبْنِيّ
explanation: المبني من الأسماء doesn't change endings regardless of position. Uses في مَحَلِّ رَفْع/نَصْب/جَرّ. Includes pronouns, demonstratives, relatives.

examples.arabic: جَاءَ هَذَا: هَذَا في محل رفع فاعل
examples.english: This came: هَذَا in nominative position

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُ هَذَا: هَذَا في محل نصب مفعول
examples.english: I saw this: هَذَا in accusative position

title: أَنْوَاع الأَسْمَاء الْمَبْنِيَّة
explanation: الضَّمَائِر، أَسْمَاء الإِشَارَة (except duals)، الْمَوْصُولَات (except duals)، أَسْمَاء الاسْتِفْهَام (except أَيّ)، أَسْمَاء الشَّرْط.

examples.arabic: هُوَ، هَذَا، الَّذِي، مَنْ، أَيْنَ: مبنيّ
examples.english: He, this, who, who?, where: indeclinable
These two, which two, which: declinable

title: الأَعْدَاد التَّرْتِيبِيَّة 1-10
explanation: Ordinals indicate position in sequence. They AGREE in gender (unlike cardinals 3-10). Pattern: فَاعِل. Masc: أَوَّل، ثَانٍ، ثَالِث... Fem: أُولَى، ثَانِيَة، ثَالِثَة...

examples.english: The first book / the first page

title: الأَعْدَاد التَّرْتِيبِيَّة 11+
explanation: 11-19: both parts agree in gender, مبني على الفتح. 20+: tens same as cardinal; compounds use ordinal unit + cardinal ten.

title: الْمِائَة وَالأَلْف
explanation: مِائَة (feminine) and أَلْف (masculine) take singular genitive counted noun (إضافة). مِائَةُ كِتَابٍ، أَلْفُ سَنَةٍ. 200: dual مِائَتَانِ.

title: الْمِلْيُون وَمَا فَوْقَهُ
explanation: مِلْيُون (masculine) takes singular genitive counted noun. Plural: مَلَايِين. مِلْيَار/بِلْيُون for billion. Follow same إضافة pattern.

title: قَوَاعِد الْعَدَد 3-10
explanation: 3-10 REVERSE gender (masc noun = fem number with ة). Counted noun: جَمْع مَجْرُور (plural genitive). ثَلَاثَةُ رِجَالٍ، ثَلَاثُ نِسَاءٍ.

title: قَوَاعِد الْعَدَد 11-99
explanation: 11-12: both parts agree. 13-19: first reverses, second agrees. 20-99: units follow rules, tens unchanged. All take مُفْرَد مَنْصُوب (singular accusative).

examples.arabic: أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوْكَبًا / إِحْدَى عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً

title: الْجُمَل الَّتِي لَا مَحَلَّ لَهَا - الأَنْوَاع السِّتَّة
titleEn: Sentences Without Position - The Six Types
explanation: Six sentence types have no grammatical position: الابتدائية (opens speech), الاستئنافية (new topic), صلة الموصول (relative clause), جواب القسم (oath response), التفسيرية (explanatory), الاعتراضية (parenthetical).

title: الْجُمَل الَّتِي لَا مَحَلَّ لَهَا - التَّفْسِيرِيَّة وَالاعْتِرَاضِيَّة
titleEn: Sentences Without Position - Explanatory and Parenthetical
explanation: الجملة التفسيرية explains a preceding ambiguity: أَشَرْتُ إِلَيْهِ أَنِ اذْهَبْ. الجملة الاعتراضية is parenthetical for تحسين الكلام: زَيْدٌ - حَفِظَهُ اللهُ - كَرِيمٌ.

examples.english: Shall I guide you to a trade... Believe (explanatory)
Al-Shafi'i - may Allah have mercy - said (parenthetical)

title: عَدَا وَخَلَا وَحَاشَا - الْفِعْلِيَّة وَالْحَرْفِيَّة
titleEn: Ada, Khala, Hasha - Verb or Particle
explanation: عدا، خلا، حاشا can function as فعل (noun after = مفعول منصوب) or حرف جر (noun after = مجرور). Both analyses are valid in Arabic grammar.

title: مَا عَدَا وَمَا خَلَا - التَّنْصِيب الْوَاجِب
titleEn: Ma Ada and Ma Khala - Obligatory Accusative
explanation: When preceded by ما المصدرية, عدا/خلا become verbs obligatorily. The noun after is مفعول به منصوب (accusative only). حاشا cannot be preceded by ما.

title: الْحُرُوف الزَّائِدَة - التَّأْكِيد وَالتَّوْكِيد
explanation: الحروف الزائدة are added for emphasis (توكيد) without changing core meaning. Common types: الباء الزائدة (after كفى، ليس), من الزائدة (after negation), اللام الزائدة, ما الزائدة.

examples.english: No one came to us (من extra)

title: الْحُرُوف الزَّائِدَة - الإِعْرَاب
explanation: Noun after زائد particle: مجرور لفظًا but keeps original position محلًّا. Example: 'كَفَى بِاللهِ' - اللهِ is مجرور لفظًا but في محل رفع فاعل.

examples.arabic: لَيْسَ زَيْدٌ بِقَائِمٍ: بقائم مجرور لفظًا منصوب محلًّا
إِنَّ اللهَ لَغَفُورٌ: اللام = لام المزحلقة

title: الإِلْغَاء - إِبْطَال الْعَمَل
explanation: الإلغاء cancels the governance of أفعال القلوب when they come AFTER objects (تأخر الفعل). Objects become مبتدأ + خبر (both مرفوع) instead of مفعولين.

examples.english: Zayd is standing, I thought (مبتدأ + خبر)

title: التَّعْلِيق - تَعْلِيق الْعَمَل
explanation: التعليق suspends governance due to intervening particles with صدارة (priority): لام الابتداء، ما النافية، لا النافية، أدوات الاستفهام. Sentence is في محل نصب.

examples.english: I knew Zayd IS standing (ل blocks)
I thought which of them is best

title: لَا سِيَّمَا - التَّرْكِيب
explanation: لا سيّما = لا + سِيَّ + ما. لا is نافية للجنس, سِيَّ is its اسم (منصوب), ما is اسم موصول أو زائدة. Means 'especially' or 'particularly.'

examples.arabic: لَا سِيَّمَا: لا نافية، سِيَّ اسمها

title: لَا سِيَّمَا - إِعْرَاب مَا بَعْدَهَا
titleEn: La Siyyama - Case of Following Noun
explanation: Three valid cases: رَفْع (as خبر لمبتدأ محذوف 'هو'), جَرّ (as مضاف إليه with ما زائدة), نَصْب (as تمييز or with ما موصولة عائدها محذوف).

title: مَا الْكَافَّة - الْمُكَفُّوفَات
explanation: ما الكافة prevents إِنَّ وأخواتها and رُبَّ from governing. They become مكفوفة (neutralized) and can be followed by جُمَل فعلية: إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى اللهَ الْعُلَمَاءُ.

examples.english: The believers are only brothers (no governance)
Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish

title: إِنَّمَا وَالْحَصْر
explanation: إِنَّمَا indicates حَصْر (restriction, 'only'). It can precede nominal or verbal sentences. Unlike إِنَّ, it doesn't govern. Meaning becomes exclusive/restrictive.

examples.english: I am ONLY a human like you

title: نِدَاء مَا فِيهِ أَلْ
explanation: يَا cannot directly precede أَلْ. Use أَيُّهَا (masculine) or أَيَّتُهَا (feminine) as intermediary. أَيُّ is مُنَادَى مبني على الضم, the noun after is بدل or عطف بيان.

title: نِدَاء الْمُضَاف إِلَى يَاء الْمُتَكَلِّم
explanation: Options: يَا رَبِّ (delete ياء, keep كسرة), يَا رَبِّي (keep ياء), يَا أَبَتِ/أُمَّتِ (ت substitutes ياء for tenderness). All forms are valid.

examples.arabic: يَا أَبَتِ لِمَ تَعْبُدُ (تاء بدل الياء)
examples.english: O my father, why worship (ta for ya)

title: التَّقْدِيم الْوَاجِب
explanation: Fronting is وَاجِب when: (1) subject is indefinite, predicate is prepositional (فِي الدَّارِ رَجُلٌ), (2) question words (مَنْ جَاءَ؟), (3) predicate has ضمير referring back to subject.

examples.english: In the house is a man (obligatory)

title: التَّقْدِيم الْمُمْتَنِع
explanation: Fronting is مُمْتَنِع (prohibited) for: مضاف إليه before مضاف, حال before صاحبها when indefinite, جار ومجرور separation, direct object before obligatory فاعل.

title: كَأَيِّنْ - كِنَايَة عَنِ الْعَدَد
explanation: كَأَيِّنْ (also كَائِن) means 'how many' like كم الخبرية. It is مبنية على السكون. Key difference: تمييز is مجرور بِمِنْ (not منصوب like كم).

examples.english: How many a town We destroyed

title: كَذَا - الْعَدَد الْمُبْهَم
explanation: كَذَا means 'such and such a number' - known to speaker but unspecified. From كَ (like) + ذَا (this). تمييز is usually منصوب. Can be repeated: كَذَا وَكَذَا.

title: أَسْمَاء الأَصْوَات - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: أَسْمَاء الأَصْوَات are words representing sounds - animal calls (هَلَا for horses) and human interjections (أُفٍّ for disgust). They are مَبْنِيَّة and have no إعراب.

title: أَسْمَاء الأَصْوَات - الأَنْوَاع
explanation: Two types: أَصْوَات لِلْحَيَوَان (animal: هَلَا for horses, نَخْ for camels, بِسّ for cats) and أَصْوَات لِلإِنْسَان (human: أُفٍّ disgust, آهِ pain, هَيْهَاتَ distance).

examples.english: Far, far is what you're promised

title: الْحِكَايَة - التَّعْرِيف
explanation: الحِكَايَة is quoting words or speech exactly, preserving original form. The quoted element (مَحْكِيّ) maintains its original إعراب regardless of position in the new sentence.

examples.english: He said: 'Praise be to Allah' (exact quote)

title: الْحِكَايَة - الإِعْرَاب
explanation: المَحْكِيّ is مبني على ما سُمِع به (indeclinable as heard). In analysis: محكيٌّ لا محل له، or في محل according to context. Quoted sentences as مفعول به of قال are في محل نصب.

examples.arabic: «الحمدُ للهِ»: جملة محكية في محل نصب

title: أَقْسَامُ الْعَلَم - الْمَنْقُول وَالْمُرْتَجَل
explanation: العلم المنقول: transferred from another word (يَزِيد from verb, حَسَن from adjective). العلم المرتجل: coined originally as a name, not transferred from another word.

title: أَقْسَامُ الْعَلَم - الْغَلَبَة وَاللَّقَب وَالْكُنْيَة
explanation: العلم بالغلبة: common noun becomes proper (الكتاب = القرآن). اللقب: nickname (الصِّدِّيق). الكُنْيَة: with أبو/أم (أبو بكر).

title: الْوَقْف - التَّعْرِيف وَالأَنْوَاع
explanation: الوَقْف is pausing in recitation. Types: تَامّ (complete meaning), كَافٍ (mostly complete), حَسَن (grammatically sound), قَبِيح (breaks meaning - avoided).

title: هَاءُ السَّكْت وَالابْتِدَاء
explanation: هاء السكت: هاء added at pause to preserve vowel (عَمَّ → عَمَّهْ). الابتداء: starting from a place that gives complete meaning, not distorting it.

examples.arabic: لَا تَبْدَأْ بِـ«لَا إِلَهَ» ثُمَّ تَقِفْ
examples.english: Don't start with 'no god' then stop

title: الْمُطَابَقَة - اسْم الْجَمْع وَكِلَا/كِلْتَا
explanation: اسم الجمع (قَوْم، نَاس) can take singular OR plural agreement. كِلَا/كِلْتَا (both) can take singular OR dual agreement - both valid.

examples.english: The people came (sing. or plur. verb)
Both men present (sing. or dual adj.)

title: الْمُطَابَقَة - الْفِعْل وَالْفَاعِل
explanation: When verb precedes subject, verb is singular: جَاءَ الرِّجَالُ. When subject precedes, full agreement: الرِّجَالُ جَاءُوا. Broken plurals of non-rational take feminine singular.

title: تَعَدُّد الْخَبَر
explanation: One مبتدأ can have multiple أخبار, all مرفوع: زَيْدٌ عَالِمٌ كَرِيمٌ شُجَاعٌ. Differs from عطف which uses و between predicates.

title: أَحْكَام الْحَذْف
explanation: المبتدأ/الخبر deletion: جَوَازًا when context clear (كَيْفَ زَيْدٌ؟ مَرِيضٌ), وُجُوبًا in specific structures (after لَوْلَا: الخبر deleted, estimated مَوْجُود).

examples.english: If not for Zayd, I'd perish (obligatory)

title: نِعْمَ وَبِئْسَ - الْفَاعِل وَالْمَخْصُوص
titleEn: Ni'ma and Bi'sa - Subject and Specified
explanation: نِعْمَ/بِئْسَ: praise/blame verbs, جامدة. الفاعل must be عام (general): معرف بأل, مضاف, or تمييز. المخصوص is the specific praised/blamed, always مرفوع.

examples.arabic: نِعْمَ الرَّجُلُ زَيْدٌ (الرجل فاعل، زيد مخصوص)

title: صِيَغ التَّعَجُّب وَشُرُوطُهُ
explanation: Two forms: مَا أَفْعَلَهُ and أَفْعِلْ بِهِ. Conditions: verb must be ثلاثي، تام، متصرف، مثبت، not colors/defects. For non-qualifying verbs, use: مَا أَشَدَّ + quality.

title: عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا - الْاِسْتِثْنَاء الْمُزْدَوَج
explanation: These particles function as either prepositions (جر) or verbs (نصب). As حروف جر, the excepted noun is مجرور. As أفعال, it's منصوب as مفعول به. With ما المصدرية, they must be verbs.

examples.arabic: جَاءَ الْقَوْمُ عَدَا زَيْدٍ / عَدَا زَيْدًا
examples.english: The people came except Zayd (جر or نصب)
Except Muhammad (must be verb with ما)

title: لَيْسَ وَلَا يَكُونُ فِي الْاِسْتِثْنَاء
titleEn: Using laysa and lā yakūnu for Exception
explanation: ليس and لا يكون can express exception. The excepted noun is their خبر (منصوب). Their اسم is a hidden pronoun. Classical poets use this for stylistic variation.

examples.english: The people came, not being Zayd
They attended, not being your brother

title: مَا الْكَافَّة وَإِنَّمَا
explanation: ما الكافة attaches to إنّ and sisters, neutralizing their governance. إنّما becomes a single حرف للحصر (restriction). The sentence after it is regular (مبتدأ مرفوع, not منصوب).

examples.english: Life is as if a dream

title: لَامُ الْاِبْتِدَاء وَنُونُ الْوِقَايَة
explanation: لام الابتداء: emphatic لام on مبتدأ or خبر إنّ (لَزَيْدٌ قَائِمٌ / إِنَّ زَيْدًا لَقَائِمٌ). نون الوقاية: inserted before ياء المتكلم with verbs/particles (أَكْرَمَنِي، لَيْتَنِي).

examples.english: Indeed truth is clear (لام on خبر)

title: لَمَّا الْحِينِيَّة وَكُلَّمَا
explanation: لمّا الحينية means 'when' (temporal), followed by past verbs. كلّما means 'whenever/every time' - indicates repeated action. Both introduce conditional-like clauses with past tense verbs.

examples.english: When Zayd came, I honored him

title: أَدَوَاتُ الشَّرْطِ الْمَكَانِيَّةُ وَالزَّمَانِيَّةُ
explanation: أينما/حيثما (wherever), أنّى (wherever/however), أيّان (whenever-future), مهما (whatever). All cause jazm to following verbs. Used for place, time, and manner conditions.

examples.english: Wherever you are, death will reach you
Whatever you do, you are responsible
